item.description:
Let's go check out Olde Fashion Sunday in Newburyport!

Full day of activities with a taste of days gone by
Olde Fashioned Sunday combines many fun activities that take you back to a bygone era all in one day.



We will meet in the front of CVS near the mail box and walk over the festivities, we can all stay together or we can separate, there is so much going on.

Parking: Most of the streets around Bartlet Mall will be closed off, try parking in the back of the CVS parking lot or on the side streets. Children are welcome at this event.


Cost: This is a pay as you go event, there is no admission fee to go to all the events below, just if you want to buy anything extra.

Check out their schedule:
7:30-Noon
Turning Point, Inc.’s Pancake Breakfast on Court House Side
Pancake Breakfast: Blueberry or Chocolate Chip Pancakes, Bacon or Sausage, Juice & coffee.
ALL YOU CAN EAT!
Cost: $6.00; Children under 3 free.
Sponsored by Turning Point, Inc., a local social serice agency.

9am-5pm
Native American Indian Gathering at Lower Pond (Eight Hour "Gathering" or "Pow-Wow")
10am-5pm
Art on Bartlet Mall
10:30am-1pm
Antique Cars on Pond Street
10am-3pm
Roaming Railroad around the pond
10am-3pm
J&J Ponies - lower pond
11am-3pm
Fly fishing demonstration
10am-4pm
Yankee Homecoming Food Booth (hot dogs)
12:30-2pm
Canoe Tilt on Frog Pond (with Don Kelly)
Sign up at Food Booth

MAIN STAGE
12-1pm
Opening Ceremonies - Dennis Palazzo Hosting
1:15-2pm
Lighthouse Jubilees
2:15-3:15pm
Overboard (Male A Cappella group)
3:30-4:30pm
Merrimack Valley Concert Band
POND STREET
3-4:30pm
Parade of Hand Tubs "Neptune’s & Oulde Newbury" from Marlboro Street to Pond Street for
Hand Tub Muster
12-3pm
Horseshoe Tournament at Elks Club

To find out more information about the Pow-Wow here http://www.yankeehome...


We will have the Meetup phone: 978-304-2811 call if you are running late or lost.
We look forward to seeing you at this event!
Donna & Janet
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the front of CVS near the mail boxes.
item.name: Olde Fashion Sunday in Newburyport
